content.title: Describing People - Physical Appearance
content.instructions: Choose the correct answer for each question.

questions.question: What color eyes has she got?
questions.explanation: La pregunta se refiere al color de los ojos, y 'Brown' (marrón) es el único color entre las opciones.

questions.question: He has got ____ hair.
questions.explanation: La oración describe el tipo de cabello que tiene, y 'short' (corto) es el adjetivo correcto para describir el cabello. Las otras opciones no son adjetivos adecuados para el cabello.

questions.question: She is wearing a ____ dress.
questions.explanation: En inglés, el orden correcto es adjetivo de opinión seguido del adjetivo de color: 'beautiful red'.

questions.question: They have got ____ eyes.
questions.explanation: La pregunta se refiere al color de los ojos, y 'green' (verde) es el único color entre las opciones. Las otras opciones no son adjetivos adecuados para describir los ojos.

questions.sentence: Luis ____ (will) go to the beach tomorrow if it doesn't rain.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'will' para hacer predicciones sobre el futuro. Aquí se predice que Luis irá a la playa si no llueve.

questions.sentence: Maria ____ (is going) to visit her grandmother this weekend.
questions.explanation: Usamos el presente continuo para hablar de planes futuros. En este caso, Maria tiene el plan de visitar a su abuela el fin de semana.

questions.sentence: This is the ____ (biggest) cake I have ever seen!
questions.explanation: Usamos el superlativo 'biggest' para indicar que este pastel es el más grande que alguien ha visto.

questions.sentence: There are ____ (some) apples in the basket.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'some' con sustantivos contables plurales para indicar que hay una cantidad no especificada de manzanas en la canasta.

questions.sentence: The soup is ____ (very) hot, be careful!
questions.explanation: Usamos 'very' como un adverbio de grado para intensificar el adjetivo 'hot', indicando que la sopa está muy caliente.

questions.sentence: We ____ (should) wear coats because it's cold outside.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'should' como un verbo modal para dar consejos. Aquí se aconseja usar abrigos porque hace frío.

questions.sentence: You ____ (have to) finish your homework before you can play.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'have to' para indicar obligación. En esta oración, es necesario terminar la tarea antes de poder jugar.

questions.sentence: My sister ____ (has got) long brown hair and green eyes.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'has got' para describir posesiones o características físicas. Aquí describe el cabello y los ojos de la hermana.

sentences.hint: Recuerda que usamos 'have got' para descripciones de apariencia.
Los adjetivos de color van antes del sustantivo.
El adjetivo describe al sustantivo y va antes de él.
Los adjetivos de color preceden al sustantivo.

sentences.translation: El gato tiene el pelaje blanco.
sentences.hint: Usa 'have got' para describir características.

content.title: Speaking Analysis: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Choose the most appropriate option for each speaking situation

questions.scenario: You are meeting a new classmate for the first time. They ask about your friend who is joining you.
questions.question: How would you describe your friend to the classmate?
options: A: She has got long brown hair and blue eyes.
B: She blue eyes and long brown has got hair.
C: Brown long hair and she has got blue eyes.
D: She has got hair long and eyes blue.
questions.explanation: En inglés, el orden es: adjetivo + sustantivo. 'Long brown hair' y 'blue eyes' están en el orden correcto.

questions.scenario: You are at a party and someone asks you about the host.
questions.question: What is a polite way to describe the host's appearance?
options: A: The host looks tired but is very charming.
B: The host tired looks but is charming very.
C: Looks tired the host but very charming is.
D: The tired host looks but charming is very.
questions.explanation: El adjetivo va antes del sustantivo: 'tired' describe cómo se ve la persona, seguido de 'charming' como una característica permanente.

questions.scenario: You are telling a friend about someone you met who was very fashionable.
questions.question: How would you describe this person?
options: A: She's got a great sense of style and her clothes are always colorful.
B: She's got style great sense a and colorful are always her clothes.
C: A sense great of style she's got and colorful always are clothes her.
D: She's style got a great sense of and clothes colorful are her always.
questions.explanation: La estructura correcta es 'great sense of style' y 'clothes are always colorful'.

questions.scenario: You are describing your new teacher to your parents.
questions.question: Which is the best way to describe your teacher?
options: A: My teacher has got short black hair and green eyes.
B: My teacher has short black hair got and green eyes.
C: Short black hair my teacher has got and eyes green.
D: My teacher black short hair has got and eyes green.
questions.explanation: Para describir características físicas, el adjetivo va antes del sustantivo: 'short black hair' y 'green eyes'.

questions.scenario: You are at a family reunion and want to introduce your cousin to a relative.
questions.question: How would you introduce your cousin?
options: A: This is my cousin. He has got curly brown hair and a friendly smile.
B: This is my cousin. Curly brown hair he has got and smile a friendly.
C: My cousin this is. He curly brown hair has got and smile friendly a.
D: This is cousin my. He has got brown curly hair and a smile friendly.
questions.explanation: El orden correcto en inglés es 'curly brown hair' y 'a friendly smile'. El adjetivo precede al sustantivo.

content.title: Word Search: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Find the hidden words in the grid

content.title: Crossword: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Complete the crossword puzzle

items.clue: This is a light hair color, often seen in people from northern Europe.
You use these to see, and they can be blue, green, or brown.
The opposite of short.
When you are happy, you do this with your mouth.
Some men have this on their face.
Many people _ _ _ _ _ _ _ _ hair and eyes.

content.title: Describing Appearance
content.textPassage: Anna and her family are going to a family reunion. Anna has got long, dark hair and bright blue eyes. She is wearing a yellow dress today. Her brother, Tom, has got short, curly hair and green eyes. He likes to wear a red t-shirt and blue jeans. Their mother, Mrs. Smith, has got straight, blonde hair and brown eyes. She is wearing a simple white blouse and a black skirt. Mr. Smith, their father, has got grey hair and brown eyes. He always wears a blue suit when they go to special events. Anna's little sister, Lucy, has got short, brown hair and hazel eyes. She loves her pink dress and wears it whenever she can. Together, they make a colorful and happy family!

questions.question: What color is Anna's dress?
questions.explanation: El texto menciona que Anna está usando un vestido amarillo.

questions.question: Who has got curly hair?
questions.explanation: Tom tiene el cabello corto y rizado, según el texto.

questions.question: Mr. Smith always wears a blue suit. True or False?
questions.explanation: El texto dice que Mr. Smith siempre usa un traje azul para eventos especiales.

questions.question: What color are Lucy's eyes?
questions.explanation: Lucy tiene ojos color avellana, como se menciona en el texto.

questions.question: What does Mrs. Smith wear?
questions.explanation: El texto indica que Mrs. Smith lleva una blusa blanca simple y una falda negra.

questions.question: Who has got blonde hair?
questions.explanation: Mrs. Smith tiene el cabello rubio según la descripción en el texto.

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT mentioned in the text?
questions.explanation: El texto no menciona cuál es el color favorito de Anna.

content.title: Práctica de Pronunciación: Énfasis en el Orden de Adjetivos y Sustantivos
content.instructions: Practica la pronunciación del orden correcto de adjetivos y sustantivos en inglés. Escucha los ejemplos, repite las frases y presta atención a cómo se enfatiza cada palabra.

targetSentences.english: She has got long brown hair.
targetSentences.spanish: Ella tiene el pelo largo y castaño.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Asegúrate de pronunciar claramente el sonido 'h' en 'hair'.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Enfatiza la palabra 'long' para describir la longitud antes del color 'brown'.

targetSentences.english: The young boy has blue eyes.
targetSentences.spanish: El niño joven tiene ojos azules.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Cuida la pronunciación de 'blue' para que no suene como 'blew'.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Enfoca en 'young' como adjetivo de edad antes de 'boy'.

targetSentences.english: He’s got a small red car.
targetSentences.spanish: Él tiene un coche pequeño y rojo.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Pronuncia la 'r' en 'red' de forma clara.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Acentúa 'small' antes del color 'red' para describir el tamaño.

targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Asegúrate de que 'green' suene claro y no se mezcle con 'eyes'.

targetSentences.english: The tall man has a black hat.
targetSentences.spanish: El hombre alto tiene un sombrero negro.
targetSentences.phonetic: /ðə tɔːl mæn hæz ə blæk hæt/
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Presta atención a la 'h' aspirada en 'hat'.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Enfatiza 'tall' como descripción de altura antes de 'man'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No cambiar el orden de 'tall' y 'man'.

content.title: Describing Appearance: Have Got and Adjective + Noun Order
content.instructions: Elija la mejor opción para completar las frases sobre la descripción física.

questions.question: Samantha _____ long, brown hair and green eyes.
questions.explanation: La forma correcta del verbo en tercera persona del singular es 'has got' cuando hablamos de posesión.

questions.question: My brother has got a _____ shirt.
questions.explanation: El orden correcto de los adjetivos en inglés es 'opinion + color + noun', por lo que 'beautiful blue' es correcto.

questions.question: She has got _____ eyes.
questions.explanation: En inglés, el orden correcto de los adjetivos es 'size + color', por lo que 'big blue eyes' es correcto.

questions.question: Tom _____ a tall man with short hair.
questions.explanation: En tercera persona del singular, usamos 'has got' para describir características físicas o posesiones.

questions.sentence: She ___ got a big blue house near the beach.
questions.explanation: En inglés, usamos 'has' para la tercera persona del singular (he, she, it) cuando hablamos de posesiones o características.

questions.sentence: He ___ going to visit his grandparents tomorrow.
questions.explanation: Para formar el futuro próximo con 'going to', utilizamos 'is' con 'he', 'she', 'it'.

questions.sentence: My brother is taller ___ my sister.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'than' para comparaciones, indicando que una cosa es más que otra.

questions.sentence: Would you like ___ cup of tea?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'a' antes de palabras que comienzan con un sonido consonante. 'Cup' comienza con 'c', que es un sonido consonante.

questions.sentence: The tall woman has ___ black hair.
questions.explanation: En inglés británico, 'have got' se utiliza para hablar de posesiones. 'Has got' se usa con la tercera persona del singular.

questions.sentence: This room is not big ___ for the party.
questions.explanation: Se utiliza 'enough' después de un adjetivo para indicar que algo es suficiente.

questions.sentence: I have to wear ___ uniform at school.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'a' antes de palabras que comienzan con un sonido consonante. 'Uniform' comienza con 'u', que se pronuncia como 'ju', un sonido consonante.

sentences.hint: Usa 'have got' para describir posesión y adjetivos antes del sustantivo.
Recuerda el orden adjetivo + sustantivo.
Coloca 'have got' y luego el adjetivo antes del sustantivo.

sentences.translation: Paul es alto y tiene el pelo rizado.
sentences.hint: Describe primero la altura, luego el cabello con 'have got'.

sentences.translation: Sarah tiene ojos marrones y pelo corto.
sentences.hint: Usa 'have got' para cada parte de la descripción.

content.title: Speaking Analysis: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Choose the most appropriate option for each speaking situation

questions.scenario: You are describing a friend to someone who is going to meet her for the first time.
questions.question: How would you describe her hair?
options: A. She has got long brown hair.
B. She have got brown long hair.
C. She got brown long hair.
D. She has got hair long brown.
questions.explanation: En inglés, el orden correcto de los adjetivos es ADJETIVO + SUSTANTIVO. Por eso, la opción correcta es 'long brown hair'.

questions.scenario: You are talking about someone's eye color in a casual conversation.
questions.question: What is the best way to mention her eye color?
options: A. She has gotten blue eyes.
questions.explanation: La estructura correcta es 'have/has got' seguida por el color y luego el sustantivo: 'blue eyes'.

questions.scenario: You are describing someone's appearance in a formal context.
questions.question: Which expression is most appropriate?
options: A. He's got a bunch of tattoos.
C. He has loads of tattoos.
questions.explanation: En un contexto formal, 'He possesses numerous tattoos' es más apropiado debido al uso de un lenguaje formal.

questions.scenario: You are describing a person's height and build in an informal chat.
questions.question: Which phrase fits best?
options: A. He is a tall and slim man.
B. He's a tall slim man.
D. He is a slim man tall.
questions.explanation: En conversaciones informales, se pueden omitir palabras como 'and' si el contexto es claro. 'Tall slim man' es correcto porque sigue el orden adjetivo + sustantivo.

questions.scenario: You're describing someone's clothing in a friendly conversation.
questions.question: Which option sounds most natural?
options: A. She's wearing a red beautiful dress.
B. She has got a beautiful red dress on.
C. She's got on a dress red beautiful.
D. She wear beautiful dress red.
questions.explanation: El orden correcto en inglés para adjetivos es 'beautiful red dress'. 'Has got on' es una expresión común para describir lo que alguien lleva puesto.

questions.scenario: You are describing a person's facial features in a detailed manner.
questions.question: Which description is best?
options: A. He has a square jaw and bright blue eyes.
B. He got a square jaw and eyes bright blue.
C. He has jaw square and eyes blue bright.
D. He has jaw square and blue bright eyes.
questions.explanation: El adjetivo siempre va antes del sustantivo y el color antes del sustantivo en inglés: 'square jaw' y 'bright blue eyes'.

content.title: Word Search: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Find the hidden words in the grid

clues.clue: A common hair and eye color

content.title: Crossword: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Complete the crossword puzzle

items.clue: She has got __________ hair. (fair color)
He is not short, he is __________.
Her eyes are __________.
He has got a thick __________ on his face.
He wears __________ to see better.
She has got __________ hair, not long.
His eyes are the color of grass. They are __________.
She is not thin, she is __________.

content.title: Describing Appearance
content.textPassage: Maria has got long brown hair and bright blue eyes. She is quite tall and has a slim figure. Her favorite color is green, so she often wears green clothes. Today, she is wearing a green shirt and a pair of blue jeans. Maria's best friend, Anna, has got short black hair and warm brown eyes. Anna is not as tall as Maria, but she has a strong build. She loves wearing red dresses because she thinks they look elegant. Both Maria and Anna enjoy going to the park on weekends. They like to sit under the big old trees and read books. Maria prefers reading mystery novels, while Anna enjoys romantic stories. They have been friends since childhood and love spending time together.

questions.question: What color are Maria's eyes?
questions.explanation: En el texto se menciona que Maria tiene ojos azules brillantes. Es importante identificar los detalles específicos de la descripción física.

questions.question: What does Anna like to wear?
questions.explanation: Anna prefiere los vestidos rojos porque piensa que se ven elegantes, según el texto. Esto prueba la comprensión de detalles específicos.

questions.question: Who is taller, Maria or Anna?
questions.explanation: El texto indica que Maria es más alta que Anna. Es necesario inferir información de la descripción dada.

questions.question: True or False: Maria and Anna like reading the same type of books.
questions.explanation: Maria prefiere novelas de misterio y Anna disfruta de historias románticas. Esto demuestra cómo los detalles pueden diferenciarse en una lectura.

questions.question: What is Maria wearing today?
options: A green shirt and blue jeans
questions.answer: A green shirt and blue jeans
questions.explanation: El texto describe específicamente la ropa de Maria hoy. Observar detalles precisos es crucial para la comprensión.

questions.question: What do Maria and Anna like to do at the park?
questions.explanation: En el texto, se menciona que disfrutan leyendo libros bajo los árboles en el parque. Comprender actividades mencionadas es parte de la comprensión general.

content.title: Práctica de Pronunciación: Énfasis en las Palabras
content.instructions: Practica la pronunciación de estas oraciones en inglés enfocándote en el énfasis correcto de las palabras. Lee cada oración, escucha el audio y repite. Usa las transcripciones fonéticas para ayudarte. Recuerda prestar atención a los consejos de pronunciación.

targetSentences.englishSentence: The young man has got curly hair.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: El joven tiene el pelo rizado.
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: /ðə jʌŋ mæn hæz gɒt ˈkɜː.li heə/
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfoca la pronunciación en 'curly' asegurándote de que suene claro.

targetSentences.englishSentence: She has got blue eyes.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ella tiene ojos azules.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Asegúrate de enfatizar 'blue' con claridad.

targetSentences.englishSentence: They have got a new car.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ellos tienen un coche nuevo.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Resalta 'new' para que se escuche claramente.

targetSentences.englishSentence: She has got long brown hair.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ella tiene el pelo largo y marrón.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfoca en 'brown' para una pronunciación clara.

targetSentences.englishSentence: He has got short black hair.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Él tiene el pelo corto y negro.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Asegúrate de que 'black' tenga el énfasis correcto.

content.title: Describe People: Appearance and Attributes
content.instructions: Choose the correct option to complete the sentences about people's appearance.

questions.question: Maria ____ long, brown hair and green eyes.
questions.explanation: La forma correcta es 'has got' porque 'Maria' es tercera persona singular.

questions.question: The man is wearing a ____ hat.
questions.explanation: El orden correcto de los adjetivos es 'big black' porque el tamaño va antes del color.

questions.question: John ____ to wear glasses because he can't see well.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'must' para expresar obligación personal.

questions.question: She is a ____ woman with a friendly smile.
questions.explanation: El adjetivo 'tall' va antes del sustantivo 'woman', por lo tanto se usa 'a tall woman'.

questions.sentence: María _____ (have got) a lot of books in her room.
questions.explanation: En inglés, se utiliza 'has got' para decir que alguien posee algo. En este caso, 'María' es tercera persona del singular, por lo tanto usamos 'has got'.

questions.sentence: There _____ (be) any cookies left in the jar?
questions.explanation: Para preguntas negativas en inglés, se usa 'aren't' cuando se pregunta sobre cosas en plural, como 'cookies'.

questions.sentence: You _____ (should) wear a coat; it's very cold outside.
questions.explanation: 'Should' se utiliza para dar consejos. Aquí se aconseja usar un abrigo porque hace frío.

questions.sentence: How _____ (much/many) apples are in the basket?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'many' porque 'apples' es contable y estamos preguntando por la cantidad.

questions.sentence: They _____ (going to) visit their grandparents next weekend.
questions.explanation: 'Going to' se usa para hablar de planes futuros. Aquí, 'they' es plural, por lo que usamos 'are going to'.

questions.sentence: I _____ (have to) finish my homework before dinner.
questions.explanation: 'Have to' indica obligación. Aquí la obligación es terminar la tarea antes de la cena.

questions.sentence: She _____ (not have to) clean the house today.
questions.explanation: Para expresar que no hay obligación, usamos 'doesn't have to' en tercera persona singular.

questions.sentence: We _____ (shouldn't) eat too much candy.
questions.explanation: 'Shouldn't' se usa para dar un consejo negativo, en este caso, no comer muchos dulces.

sentences.hint: Sujeto + has got + adjetivo + sustantivo
Sujeto + has got + adjetivo + sustantivo
Sujeto + is + a + adjetivo + sustantivo
Sujeto + has got + adjetivo + sustantivo
Posesivo + sustantivo + are + adjetivo

content.title: Speaking Analysis: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Choose the most appropriate option for each speaking situation

questions.scenario: You are talking about your friend to someone who hasn't met them yet. You want to describe your friend's hair.
questions.question: What is the best way to describe your friend's hair?
options: A) My friend has got long black hair.
B) My friend has got black long hair.
C) My friend got long hair black.
D) My friend have got black and long hair.
questions.explanation: La opción A es correcta porque sigue el orden correcto de adjetivo + sustantivo en inglés: 'long black hair'.

questions.scenario: During a casual conversation at a café, someone mentions a woman with striking eyes.
questions.question: How might they describe her eyes?
options: A) She has got big and blue eyes.
B) She got eyes blue and big.
C) She has got blue big eyes.
D) She have got blue and big eyes.
questions.explanation: La opción A es correcta porque sigue las reglas de gramática: 'big and blue eyes'.

questions.scenario: You want to tell your friend about a man you saw at the store who looks interesting.
questions.question: Which description is most appropriate?
options: A) He has got green eyes and short brown hair.
B) He have got hair short and brown.
C) He got short and brown hair.
D) He has got short brown hair and green eyes.
questions.explanation: La opción D es correcta y completa, describiendo tanto los ojos como el cabello de manera gramaticalmente correcta.

questions.scenario: You are complimenting your classmate on their appearance for a special event.
questions.question: What is the best compliment?
options: A) You have got a beautiful dress.
B) You got a dress beautiful.
C) You have got dress beautiful.
D) You has got beautiful a dress.
questions.explanation: La opción A es correcta porque sigue el orden correcto de adjetivo + sustantivo y usa 'have got'.

questions.scenario: You are describing a famous person during a conversation.
questions.question: How would you describe their appearance?
options: A) They have got tall and slim.
B) They have got a tall and slim build.
C) They got build tall and slim.
D) They has got slim tall build.
questions.explanation: La opción B es correcta porque utiliza 'have got' con un sustantivo y adjetivos en el orden correcto.

content.title: Word Search: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Find the hidden words in the grid

clues.clue: Color of hair often light yellow.
Type of hair that is not straight.
Part of the body used to see.
A color often seen in eyes.

content.title: Crossword: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Complete the crossword puzzle

items.clue: A color of hair, similar to yellow.
The opposite of short.
We use these to see.
Hair on a man's face, below the mouth.
The color of the sky on a clear day.
You wear these to help you see better.
What you do with your mouth when you are happy.

content.title: Describing Appearance
content.text: Anna and her brother Tom have got very different appearances. Anna has got long, straight brown hair and bright blue eyes. She is quite tall and slim. People often say she looks like her mother. Tom, on the other hand, has got short, curly black hair and dark brown eyes. He is shorter than Anna and a bit more muscular. Tom likes to wear colorful clothes, especially his favorite red jacket. Anna prefers to wear simple, comfortable clothes, like her green sweater and jeans. They both have got friendly smiles, and they are always ready to help others. Despite their different looks, they get along very well and enjoy spending time together.

questions.question: What color are Anna's eyes?
questions.explanation: Anna tiene ojos azules brillantes, como se menciona en el texto.

questions.question: How can we describe Tom's hair?
questions.explanation: Tom tiene el cabello corto y rizado, lo cual está claramente especificado en el texto.

questions.question: Who is taller, Anna or Tom?
questions.explanation: Anna es descrita como más alta que Tom, por lo que la respuesta correcta es que Anna es más alta.

questions.question: What does Tom like to wear?
questions.explanation: A Tom le gusta llevar ropa colorida, especialmente su chaqueta roja favorita.

questions.question: TRUE or FALSE: Anna looks like her father.
questions.explanation: El texto indica que Anna se parece a su madre, no a su padre.

questions.question: What is the main idea of the text?
questions.explanation: El texto se centra principalmente en describir las apariencias físicas de Anna y Tom.

questions.question: What can we infer about Anna and Tom's relationship?
questions.explanation: A pesar de sus diferencias, el texto menciona que disfrutan pasar tiempo juntos, lo que indica una buena relación.

content.title: Práctica de pronunciación: Enfoque en el estrés de las palabras
content.instructions: Practiquemos el estrés de las palabras en inglés. Escucha cada oración y repite después de escuchar el audio. Presta atención al acento correcto en las palabras clave. Usa las transcripciones fonéticas para ayudarte.

targetSentences.englishSentence: She has got beautiful blue eyes.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ella tiene hermosos ojos azules.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfatiza la primera sílaba de 'beautiful' y 'blue'.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Acentuar la primera sílaba en 'beautiful' y 'blue'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Evita acentuar la sílaba incorrecta en 'beautiful'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: His hair is curly and brown.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Su cabello es rizado y marrón.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Pon el énfasis en 'curly' y asegúrate de pronunciar claramente 'brown'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No omitas el sonido final en 'brown'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: They have got a small red car.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ellos tienen un coche rojo pequeño.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Destaca la primera sílaba en 'small' y 'red'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: The woman is tall and has got blonde hair.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: La mujer es alta y tiene el cabello rubio.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfoca en 'tall' y 'blonde', asegurando una pronunciación clara.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Acentuar la primera sílaba de 'tall' y 'blonde'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: She wears a long green dress.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ella lleva un vestido largo verde.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Acentúa 'green' y 'dress', con una pronunciación clara.

content.title: Describing People: Appearance and Features
content.instructions: Choose the correct answer for each question about describing appearance using 'have got' and adjective order.

questions.question: She _______ long, curly hair.
questions.explanation: La forma correcta del verbo 'have' en tercera persona singular es 'has got'.

questions.question: He has got _______ eyes.
questions.explanation: El orden correcto en inglés es adjetivo de tamaño seguido de color, por lo que es 'big blue'.

questions.question: They _______ a small, round face.
questions.explanation: Para el pronombre 'they', usamos 'have got' ya que es plural.

questions.question: She has got _______ shirt.
questions.explanation: El orden correcto de los adjetivos en inglés es opinión seguido de color, por lo que es 'beautiful red'.

questions.sentence: Samantha _____ (have got) a small dog with brown fur.
questions.explanation: En inglés, 'have got' se usa para indicar posesión. Aquí, 'Samantha' es tercera persona singular, por lo que se usa 'has got'.

questions.sentence: My brother _____ (have got) short, black hair.
questions.explanation: Para describir posesiones o características físicas de alguien, como el cabello, usamos 'have got'. Para 'my brother', que es tercera persona singular, usamos 'has got'.

questions.sentence: We _____ (not have got) green eyes, we have blue eyes.
questions.explanation: 'Haven't got' es la forma negativa de 'have got', usada aquí para negar la posesión de ojos verdes.

questions.sentence: The tall woman _____ (have got) a red dress.
questions.explanation: La estructura es 'adjetivo + sustantivo'; en este caso, 'tall woman'. Para indicar posesión de un vestido rojo, se usa 'has got'.

questions.sentence: They _____ (have got) a big, white house near the park.
questions.explanation: Para describir una posesión como una casa, usamos 'have got'. 'They' es plural, así que usamos 'have got'.

questions.sentence: I _____ (have got) a new phone with a blue case.
questions.explanation: Para describir una posesión personal como un teléfono, usamos 'have got'. 'I' es primera persona singular, así que usamos 'have got'.

questions.sentence: Maria and Carlos _____ (have got) curly, brown hair.
questions.explanation: Para describir características físicas como el cabello, usamos 'have got'. Como 'Maria and Carlos' es plural, usamos 'have got'.

questions.sentence: The old man _____ (not have got) a beard.
questions.explanation: 'Hasn't got' es la forma negativa de 'has got', usada para negar la posesión de una barba.

sentences.hint: La estructura es sujeto + have + adjetivo + sustantivo.
Usa 'has got' para describir posesiones o características.
La estructura es sujeto + has + a + adjetivo + sustantivo.
Usa 'are' para describir características permanentes.
Usa 'has got' seguido de adjetivo + sustantivo.

content.title: Speaking Analysis: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Choose the most appropriate option for each speaking situation

questions.scenario: You are at a cafe with a friend, and someone you both know walks in. Your friend says, 'Look, there's Sarah. She has got...' What is the most appropriate way to complete the sentence?
questions.question: Choose the correct description.
options: A beautiful long hair and blue eyes.
A long beautiful hair and blue eyes.
Beautiful long hair and blue eyes.
Long beautiful hair and blue eyes.
questions.explanation: La opción C es correcta porque sigue el orden correcto de adjetivos en inglés: 'beautiful' (opinión) antes de 'long' (tamaño). La palabra 'hair' no lleva artículo 'a' porque es un sustantivo no contable.

questions.scenario: You are describing a person to a friend who hasn't met them. You say, 'He's got...'
questions.question: Choose the best description.
options: Eyes brown and short curly hair.
Brown eyes and hair short curly.
Short curly hair and brown eyes.
Hair short curly and eyes brown.
questions.explanation: La opción C es correcta porque sigue el orden del adjetivo + sustantivo. Los adjetivos 'short' y 'curly' describen el cabello y preceden al sustantivo 'hair'.

questions.scenario: You are talking about a mutual friend. Your friend asks about his appearance. You say, 'He has got...'
questions.question: Select the most natural description.
options: A tall man and brown eyes.
A tall man with brown eyes.
questions.explanation: La opción C es correcta porque usa 'with' para conectar dos descripciones: 'a tall man' y 'brown eyes'.

questions.scenario: You are at a party and someone asks you to describe your sister. You say, 'She has got...'
questions.question: Choose the right phrase.
options: Dark long hair and eyes green.
Long dark hair and green eyes.
Hair long dark and green eyes.
Eyes green and long dark hair.
questions.explanation: La opción B es correcta porque sigue el orden correcto de adjetivos: 'long' (tamaño) antes de 'dark' (color), y luego el sustantivo 'hair'.

questions.scenario: You meet someone new and want to describe their outfit to a friend. You say, 'She is wearing...'
questions.question: Pick the most appropriate description.
questions.explanation: La opción B es correcta porque sigue el orden del adjetivo: 'beautiful' (opinión) antes de 'blue' (color) y después el sustantivo 'dress'.

content.title: Word Search: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Find the hidden words in the grid

content.title: Crossword: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Complete the crossword puzzle

items.clue: Color de cabello claro y amarillo.
Color de ojos común, como el cielo.
Una persona que mide mucho de altura.
Un gesto facial que muestra felicidad.
Pelo en la cara de un hombre.
Color común para ojos y cabello.
Una persona que no es alta.

content.title: Describing Appearance
content.textPassage: Maria has got long brown hair and big green eyes. She is quite tall and slim. Her brother, Carlos, also has got green eyes, but his hair is short and dark. Carlos is not as tall as Maria, but he is very strong. They both have got friendly smiles. Maria likes wearing colorful clothes, especially her favorite red dress. Carlos often wears a blue T-shirt and black jeans. They have got a small dog with fluffy white fur. When they go to the park, Maria enjoys running with their dog, while Carlos likes to play basketball with his friends. Overall, they are a happy and active family.

questions.question: What color are Maria's eyes?
questions.explanation: En el texto se menciona que Maria tiene 'big green eyes'.

questions.question: How does Carlos's hair differ from Maria's?
questions.explanation: Carlos tiene 'short and dark' hair, mientras que Maria tiene 'long brown hair'.

questions.question: What does Maria like to wear?
questions.explanation: Maria prefiere usar ropa colorida, especialmente su 'favorite red dress'.

questions.question: Carlos is NOT described as:
questions.explanation: Carlos no es tan alto como Maria y se describe como fuerte y amistoso.

questions.question: What activity does Maria enjoy in the park?
questions.explanation: Maria disfruta correr con su perro en el parque.

questions.question: True or False: Carlos often wears a red T-shirt.
questions.explanation: Carlos lleva a menudo una 'blue T-shirt', no una roja.

questions.question: What color is the fur of their dog?
questions.explanation: El perro tiene 'fluffy white fur', es decir, pelaje blanco.

content.title: Práctica de Pronunciación: Descripción de Personas
content.instructions: Escucha las oraciones y practica la pronunciación enfocándote en el orden de adjetivos y sustantivos. Presta atención a la entonación y el énfasis correcto. Usa las pistas de pronunciación para mejorar.

targetSentences.englishSentence: She has got a small, red car.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ella tiene un coche pequeño y rojo.
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: ʃi hæz ɡɒt ə smɔːl, rɛd kɑːr
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfoca en el orden de los adjetivos: tamaño antes de color. Asegúrate de pronunciar 'red' de manera clara con un sonido fuerte de 'r'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Evita cambiar el orden a 'red small car'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: He has got brown curly hair.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Él tiene el pelo rizado y marrón.
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: hi hæz ɡɒt braʊn ˈkɜːrli heə
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Recuerda que 'curly' lleva el estrés en la primera sílaba. 'Hair' debe sonar como 'heə' en inglés británico.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No digas 'curly brown hair', el color va antes de la textura.

targetSentences.englishSentence: The tall woman is smiling.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: La mujer alta está sonriendo.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Asegúrate de enfatizar 'tall', y pronunciar 'woman' con la 'w' suave.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No cambies el orden a 'woman tall'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: They have got blue eyes.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ellos tienen ojos azules.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfócate en el sonido 'uː' en 'blue', y asegúrate de que 'eyes' tenga el sonido 'aɪz'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: She is wearing a long, green dress.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ella lleva puesto un vestido largo y verde.
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: ʃi ɪz ˈweərɪŋ ə lɒŋ, ɡriːn drɛs
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Presta atención al orden de los adjetivos, 'long' antes de 'green'. 'Dress' debe sonar como 'drɛs'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No inviertas el orden a 'green long dress'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: His brother has got a big smile.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Su hermano tiene una gran sonrisa.
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: hɪz ˈbrʌðə hæz ɡɒt ə bɪɡ smaɪl
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Enfatiza 'big', y asegúrate de que 'smile' lleva el sonido 'aɪl'.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No digas 'smile big', recuerda el orden correcto.

content.title: Describing Physical Appearance
content.instructions: Choose the correct option for each question. Use 'have got', adjective + noun order, and vocabulary about colors, physical descriptions, hair, and eyes.

questions.question: What color eyes has she got?
questions.explanation: En inglés, el adjetivo 'blue' va antes del sustantivo 'eyes'. Por eso, la respuesta correcta es 'Blue eyes'.

questions.question: He has got ________.
questions.explanation: El orden correcto de los adjetivos en inglés es 'curly' (forma) primero y luego 'brown' (color) antes del sustantivo 'hair'.

questions.question: They have got a ________.
questions.explanation: La respuesta correcta es 'small black dog', porque el orden es tamaño 'small' seguido de color 'black'.

questions.question: Has she got ________?
questions.explanation: El orden correcto en inglés es 'long' (longitud) seguido de 'blonde' (color) antes del sustantivo 'hair'.

questions.sentence: Lisa ___ (have got) a small dog. It is very cute.
questions.explanation: En inglés, usamos 'has got' para decir que alguien posee algo. En español sería 'Lisa tiene un perro pequeño'.

questions.sentence: The ___ (blue, car) is parked outside.
questions.explanation: En inglés, el adjetivo 'blue' va antes del sustantivo 'car'. En español sería 'El coche azul está aparcado afuera'.

questions.sentence: Mark ___ (should, clean) his room today.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'should' para dar consejos. En español sería 'Mark debería limpiar su habitación hoy'.

questions.sentence: She ___ (would like to, visit) the museum tomorrow.
questions.explanation: La estructura 'would like to' expresa un deseo. En español sería 'A ella le gustaría visitar el museo mañana'.

questions.sentence: There are ___ (many, apples) in the basket.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'many' para contar objetos en plural. En español sería 'Hay muchas manzanas en la cesta'.

questions.sentence: You ___ (mustn't, smoke) here. It's prohibited.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'mustn't' para indicar prohibición. En español sería 'No debes fumar aquí. Está prohibido'.

questions.sentence: We ___ (have got, a big, house) near the park.
questions.explanation: La estructura 'have got' se usa para posesión, y 'a big house' para describir. En español sería 'Tenemos una casa grande cerca del parque'.

questions.sentence: Anna ___ (wants, to have, long hair).
questions.explanation: Usamos 'wants to have' para expresar un deseo y 'long hair' para la descripción. En español sería 'Anna quiere tener el pelo largo'.

sentences.hint: Recuerda usar 'has got' para describir posesión.

sentences.translation: Peter tiene ojos grandes y azules.
sentences.hint: Los adjetivos van antes del sustantivo.

sentences.translation: Sofía tiene el pelo rizado negro.
sentences.hint: Sigue el orden: adjetivo + sustantivo.

sentences.translation: Anna tiene ojos verdes y gafas.
sentences.hint: Usa 'and' para conectar dos descripciones.

sentences.translation: Tom tiene el pelo corto y rubio.
sentences.hint: Describe el cabello usando dos adjetivos antes del sustantivo.

content.title: Speaking Analysis: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Choose the most appropriate option for each speaking situation

questions.scenario: You are at a cafe with a friend. Your friend points to someone and says, 'I like her style.'
questions.question: Which response is most appropriate?
options: A. Yes, she has got a very nice dress.
B. Yes, she got a very nice dress.
C. Yes, she is got a very nice dress.
D. Yes, she have got a very nice dress.
questions.explanation: La opción A es correcta porque 'has got' es la forma adecuada para expresar posesión en presente simple, que es parte del nivel A2.

questions.scenario: You are describing your friend's appearance to another friend.
questions.question: Which sentence uses adjective + noun order correctly?
options: A. She has got hair long brown.
B. She has got long brown hair.
C. She has got hair brown long.
D. She has got brown long hair.
questions.explanation: La opción B es correcta porque sigue la regla de orden adjetivo + sustantivo (adjective + noun), que es importante en inglés.

questions.scenario: You meet someone for the first time at a party.
questions.question: How would you politely comment on someone's appearance?
options: B. You are looking good today!
questions.explanation: La opción A es la más adecuada porque 'look' es el verbo correcto para expresar una apariencia general y 'great' es un adjetivo positivo.

questions.scenario: You are talking about a friend’s new hair color.
questions.question: Which sentence is correct?
options: A. He has got blond new hair.
B. He has got new blond hair.
C. He has got blond hair new.
D. He has got hair blond new.
questions.explanation: La opción B es correcta porque sigue la secuencia de adjetivos adecuada, primero 'new' luego 'blond', antes del sustantivo 'hair'.

questions.scenario: While discussing family pictures, someone asks about your sister.
questions.question: Which phrase describes her eye color correctly?
options: A. She has got blue eyes.
B. She has got eyes blue.
C. She has got eyes of blue.
D. She has blue got eyes.
questions.explanation: La opción A es correcta porque 'blue eyes' sigue el orden adjetivo + sustantivo, que es la forma correcta en inglés.

questions.scenario: You are describing your brother to a new friend.
questions.question: How would you describe his height?
options: D. He is a tall man.
questions.explanation: La opción D es correcta porque usa 'a tall man' para describir a una persona, incluyendo el artículo 'a' para el sustantivo 'man'.

content.title: Word Search: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Find the hidden words in the grid

content.title: Crossword: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Complete the crossword puzzle

items.clue: Color of hair that is light yellow.
A person who is not short.
Hair that grows on a man's face.
You wear these on your eyes to see better.
Color of the sky and sea.
Opposite of tall.
You use these to see.

content.title: Describing Appearance
content.text_passage: Lisa has got long, curly brown hair and bright blue eyes. She loves wearing colorful clothes, like her favorite red sweater and yellow shoes. Her best friend, Tom, has got short, straight black hair and dark brown eyes. They both like going to the park on sunny days. Lisa usually wears a pink hat to protect her fair skin from the sun. Tom, on the other hand, prefers wearing sunglasses. They often sit on a green bench and watch people passing by. Lisa thinks Tom is very handsome because he has a nice smile and a kind face. Tom says Lisa is beautiful because she always looks happy and cheerful.

questions.question: What color is Lisa's hair?
questions.explanation: El texto menciona que Lisa tiene el cabello castaño, lo que en inglés se dice 'brown'.

questions.question: What does Lisa wear to protect her skin?
questions.explanation: Lisa lleva un sombrero rosa para proteger su piel clara del sol, según el texto.

questions.question: Which of the following is TRUE about Tom?
options: He likes wearing a pink hat.
questions.explanation: El texto indica que Tom prefiere usar gafas de sol.

questions.question: What does Lisa think about Tom?
questions.explanation: Lisa piensa que Tom es guapo porque tiene una sonrisa agradable y un rostro amable.

questions.question: What does Tom say about Lisa?
questions.explanation: Tom dice que Lisa es hermosa porque siempre se ve feliz y alegre.

questions.question: Lisa and Tom like going to the park on ____ days.
questions.explanation: Ellos disfrutan ir al parque en días soleados, como menciona el texto.

questions.question: TRUE or FALSE: Lisa has got green eyes.
questions.explanation: Lisa tiene los ojos azules, no verdes.

questions.question: What is NOT mentioned about Tom?
questions.explanation: El texto no menciona que Tom lleve un suéter rojo. Se menciona que Lisa tiene un suéter rojo.

content.title: Práctica de pronunciación: Énfasis en el orden de adjetivos y sustantivos
content.instructions: Practica la pronunciación de las siguientes frases en inglés, prestando atención al orden de los adjetivos y sustantivos. Lee cada oración en voz alta y utiliza las transcripciones fonéticas para ayudarte.

targetSentences.englishSentence: She has got blue eyes and long hair.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ella tiene ojos azules y pelo largo.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Asegúrate de enfatizar el adjetivo antes del sustantivo, como 'blue' antes de 'eyes'.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Enfatizar el adjetivo antes del sustantivo.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: Colocar el sustantivo antes del adjetivo.

targetSentences.englishSentence: The tall man is wearing a red shirt.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: El hombre alto lleva una camisa roja.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Pronuncia claramente 'tall' y 'red' antes de sus respectivos sustantivos.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Pronunciación de 'tall' y 'red' antes de los nombres.

targetSentences.englishSentence: They have got a small, cozy room.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ellos tienen una habitación pequeña y acogedora.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: El énfasis debe estar en 'small' y 'cozy'.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Claridad en la pronunciación de múltiples adjetivos.
targetSentences.commonMistakes: No dejar clara la pausa entre los adjetivos.

targetSentences.englishSentence: He is wearing a black jacket and white shoes.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Él lleva una chaqueta negra y zapatos blancos.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Asegúrate de que 'black' y 'white' sean claramente audibles antes de los sustantivos.
targetSentences.focusPoints: Distinción clara entre colores y objetos.

targetSentences.englishSentence: The children have got bright smiles.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Los niños tienen sonrisas brillantes.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Pronuncia 'bright' con claridad antes de 'smiles'.

content.title: Describing Appearance: People and Physical Description
content.instructions: Choose the correct answer for each question. Focus on using have got, adjective + noun order, and vocabulary related to colors, hair, and eyes.

questions.question: What color eyes has she got?
options: A. She has got blue eyes.
B. She has got eyes blue.
C. She has blue got eyes.
D. She eyes has blue got.
questions.explanation: La estructura correcta en inglés es 'have got' seguido de 'adjective + noun'. Aquí, 'blue' es el adjetivo y 'eyes' es el sustantivo.

questions.question: He has got ___ hair.
questions.explanation: La correcta secuencia es 'adjective + noun', por lo tanto 'short black hair' es la estructura correcta.

questions.question: They have got ___ eyes.
questions.explanation: El orden correcto es 'adjective + noun', así que 'big brown eyes' es la respuesta correcta.

questions.question: My sister has got ___ hair.
questions.explanation: En inglés, usamos 'adjective + noun', así que 'long curly hair' es la forma correcta de describirlo.

questions.question: What kind of hair has he got?
options: A. He has got blonde short hair.
B. He has got hair short blonde.
C. He short blonde has got hair.
D. He has blonde got short hair.
questions.explanation: La estructura correcta es 'have got' seguido de 'adjective + noun'. Aquí, 'blonde' y 'short' son adjetivos que describen 'hair'.

questions.sentence: She ____ (have got) a beautiful blue dress.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'has got' para describir que alguien posee algo. En este caso, describimos la ropa que tiene.

questions.sentence: He ____ (have got) short black hair.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'has got' para describir características físicas como el tipo y color del cabello.

questions.sentence: They ____ (have got) green eyes and a friendly smile.
questions.explanation: Se usa 'have got' para describir características físicas y expresiones faciales.

questions.sentence: Maria ____ (have got) a tall brother with brown hair.
questions.explanation: Utilizamos 'has got' para describir relaciones familiares y características físicas.

questions.sentence: The little boy ____ (have got) a red bicycle.
questions.explanation: Empleamos 'has got' para hablar de posesiones, en este caso, el niño tiene una bicicleta.

questions.sentence: You ____ (have got) a new pair of blue shoes.
questions.explanation: Se utiliza 'have got' para describir posesiones personales, como los zapatos nuevos.

questions.sentence: My grandparents ____ (have got) a big garden with many flowers.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'have got' para describir posesiones que son grandes o notables, como un jardín.

questions.sentence: The girl ____ (have got) curly hair and a small nose.
questions.explanation: Utilizamos 'has got' para describir características físicas detalladas, como el tipo de cabello y la forma de la nariz.

exercises.hint: Usa 'has' para describir lo que alguien tiene.
Recuerda el orden: 'has got' seguido del adjetivo y luego el sustantivo.
Empieza con 'They have got' y sigue la estructura adjetivo + sustantivo.
Usa 'wears' para describir ropa, luego sigue con adjetivo + sustantivo.
Empieza con 'John has' y sigue con adjetivo + sustantivo.

content.title: Speaking Analysis: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Choose the most appropriate option for each speaking situation

questions.scenario: You are talking to a friend about someone you met at a party.
questions.question: How would you describe their hair?
options: A. They have got brown curly hair.
B. They have got curly brown hair.
C. They have got hair brown curly.
D. They have brown and hair curly.
questions.explanation: En inglés, el orden de los adjetivos antes del sustantivo es primero la calidad (curly) y luego el color (brown).

questions.scenario: A friend is describing a new classmate to you.
questions.question: Which sentence describes their eye color correctly?
options: A. She has got blue eyes.
B. She have got blue eyes.
C. She has blue got eyes.
D. She has got eyes blue.
questions.explanation: La estructura correcta es 'has got' seguido del adjetivo (color) y luego el sustantivo (eyes).

questions.scenario: You are explaining to your teacher what your favorite actor looks like.
questions.question: What is the correct way to describe their height?
questions.explanation: Para describir altura, se usa 'is' con el adjetivo 'tall'.

questions.scenario: You're talking about a famous person with a friend.
questions.question: How do you describe their hair color?
options: A. They have got a blonde hair.
B. They have got blonde hair.
C. They got blonde a hair.
D. They have blonde got hair.
questions.explanation: No se usa 'a' con el color del cabello porque 'hair' es incontable en este contexto.

questions.scenario: You see an interesting person on the street and describe them to your sibling.
questions.question: What is the best way to describe their eye shape?
questions.explanation: El adjetivo viene antes del sustantivo, así que 'round' antes de 'eyes'.

content.title: Word Search: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Find the hidden words in the grid

clues.clue: Lo que crece en tu cabeza
Pelo en la cara de un hombre

content.title: Crossword: Describing Appearance
content.instructions: Complete the crossword puzzle

items.clue: The color of chocolate. (Color del chocolate)
Hair color that is light and yellow. (Color de pelo que es claro y amarillo)
Not short, usually describes hair. (No corto, generalmente describe el pelo)
Hair on the chin and cheeks of a man. (Pelo en la barbilla y mejillas de un hombre)
Color of the sky on a clear day. (Color del cielo en un día despejado)
Opposite of short, often used for height. (Opuesto de bajo, a menudo usado para altura)
Color of grass. (Color del césped)
Describes hair with lots of curves or waves. (Describe el pelo con muchas curvas u ondas)

content.title: Describing Appearance
content.textPassage: Anna is a young girl who has got long brown hair and big green eyes. She usually wears a blue jacket and black shoes. Her best friend, Jake, has got short blond hair and dark brown eyes. They like to play in the park every Saturday. Anna's brother, Tom, has got curly black hair and small blue eyes. He always wears a red cap and white sneakers. They all enjoy going to the beach, where Anna likes to collect shells, Jake plays soccer, and Tom builds sandcastles.

questions.question: What color is Anna's hair?
questions.explanation: Anna tiene el cabello largo y marrón, como se menciona en el texto.

questions.question: What does Jake like to do at the beach?
questions.explanation: Jake juega al fútbol en la playa, según el pasaje.

questions.question: True or False: Tom always wears a red cap and white sneakers.
questions.explanation: El texto dice que Tom siempre lleva una gorra roja y zapatillas blancas.

questions.question: Who has got small blue eyes?
questions.explanation: Tom tiene ojos azules pequeños, como se describe en el texto.

questions.question: What is NOT mentioned about Anna?
options: Her favorite activity at the beach
questions.explanation: La altura de Anna no se menciona en el texto.

content.title: Práctica de Pronunciación: Enfoque en la Descripción de Apariencia
content.instructions: Practica la pronunciación de las siguientes oraciones enfocándote en el orden de adjetivos y sustantivos. Asegúrate de prestar atención a la entonación y el énfasis correcto en las palabras clave.

targetSentences.englishSentence: She has got long brown hair.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ella tiene el pelo largo y castaño.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Emphasize the beginning of each adjective and ensure a smooth flow between 'long' and 'brown'.
targetSentences.commonMistakesToAvoid: Avoid separating 'long' and 'brown' with pauses; they should be pronounced together smoothly.

targetSentences.englishSentence: He has blue eyes.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Él tiene ojos azules.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Make sure to pronounce the 's' at the end of 'eyes' clearly.
targetSentences.commonMistakesToAvoid: Do not drop the 's' at the end of 'eyes'.

targetSentences.englishSentence: My friend has got a small red notebook.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Mi amigo tiene un cuaderno pequeño y rojo.
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: /maɪ frɛnd hæz ɡɒt ə smɔːl rɛd ˈnəʊtbʊk/
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Focus on the 'r' sound in 'red' and ensure 'notebook' is pronounced as two distinct syllables.
targetSentences.commonMistakesToAvoid: Avoid merging 'red' and 'notebook' into one word; each should be distinct.

targetSentences.englishSentence: They have got a tall green tree.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: Ellos tienen un árbol alto y verde.
targetSentences.phoneticTranscription: /ðeɪ hæv ɡɒt ə tɔːl ɡriːn triː/
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Ensure a clear 't' at the beginning of 'tall' and stress the 'g' sound in 'green'.
targetSentences.commonMistakesToAvoid: Do not omit the 't' in 'tall'; it should be crisp and clear.

targetSentences.englishSentence: The girl has bright blue eyes.
targetSentences.spanishTranslation: La chica tiene ojos azul brillante.
targetSentences.pronunciationTips: Pronounce 'bright' with emphasis on the initial 'br' blend and ensure 'eyes' is pronounced with a clear 's'.

content.title: Describing People: Appearance and Physical Features
content.instructions: Choose the correct option to complete each sentence about appearance.

questions.question: Paul _____ blue eyes and short brown hair.
questions.explanation: La opción correcta es 'has got' porque estamos hablando de la tercera persona del singular (Paul), y usamos 'has got' para describir características físicas en inglés.

questions.question: She is wearing a _____ dress today.
questions.explanation: En inglés, el orden correcto de los adjetivos es primero el adjetivo de opinión, luego el adjetivo de color. Por eso, 'beautiful red' es la opción correcta.

questions.question: Tommy _____ tall and slim.
questions.explanation: La opción correcta es 'is' porque estamos utilizando el verbo 'to be' para describir el aspecto físico de Tommy.

questions.question: They _____ got curly hair.
questions.explanation: La opción correcta es 'have' porque 'they' es plural, y usamos 'have got' cuando describimos características en plural.

questions.sentence: How ______ apples do you want from the store?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'how many' con sustantivos contables en plural como 'apples'.

questions.sentence: You ______ go to the doctor if you feel sick.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'should' para dar consejos sobre lo que es mejor hacer.

questions.sentence: There isn't ______ milk left in the fridge.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'much' con sustantivos incontables como 'milk'.

questions.sentence: This soup is too hot, I can't eat it ______.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'yet' para indicar que algo no se ha completado, pero se espera que ocurra.

questions.sentence: We are going to visit our grandparents next weekend.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'going to' para expresar planes o intenciones futuras.

questions.sentence: I have to finish my homework before dinner.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'have to' para expresar necesidad u obligación.

questions.sentence: Do we have ______ time to finish the project?
questions.explanation: Usamos 'enough' para indicar suficiencia en cantidad.

questions.sentence: He is ______ shy to speak in front of the class.
questions.explanation: Usamos 'too' para indicar un exceso que impide hacer algo.
